tn.text: Hananiah claims to speak for God.

tn.ref: in the fourth year and the fifth month
tn.text: This is the fifth month of the Hebrew calendar. It is during the dry season. It is during the last part of July and the first part of August on Western calendars. AT: "in the fifth month of his fourth year (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

tn.ref: I have broken the yoke imposed by the king of Babylon
tn.text: AT: "I have stopped the control of the king of Babylon"
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:01:07|1:8]].
The Hebrew text has "Jeconiah," which is a variation of the name "Jehoiachin." Many modern versions have "Jehoiachin" in order to make it clear that the same king is being referred to.

tn.ref: The prophets who existed before me and you
tn.text: AT: "The prophets who lived before you and me many years ago"

tn.ref: then it will be known that he is indeed a prophet sent out by Yahweh
tn.text: AT: "then you will know that he is a true prophet of Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: the word of Yahweh came to
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:01:01|1:2]].

tn.ref: you broke a yoke of wood, but I will make instead a yoke of iron
tn.text: AT: "you broke a weak yoke but I will make a yoke which cannot be broken" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

This is the seventh month of the Hebrew calendar. It is during the last part of September and the first part of October on Western calendars. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
